member.name: T:Vortice.Direct3D11.BlendDescription
member.summary: Describes the blend state.

member.name: F:Vortice.Direct3D11.BlendDescription.Opaque
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for opaque blend, that is overwriting the source with the destination data.

member.name: F:Vortice.Direct3D11.BlendDescription.AlphaBlend
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for alpha blend, that is blending the source and destination data using alpha.

member.name: F:Vortice.Direct3D11.BlendDescription.Additive
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for additive blend, that is adding the destination data to the source data without using alpha.

member.name: F:Vortice.Direct3D11.BlendDescription.NonPremultiplied
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for blending with non-premultipled alpha, that is blending source and destination data using alpha while assuming the color data contains no alpha information.

member.name: M:Vortice.Direct3D11.ID3D11Resource.CalculateSubResourceIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the sub resource index from a miplevel.
member.param: A zero-based index for the mipmap level to address; 0 indicates the first, most detailed mipmap level.
The zero-based index for the array level to address; always use 0 for volume (3D) textures.
Number of mipmap levels in the resource.
member.returns: The index which equals mipSlice + (arraySlice * mipLevels).

member.name: M:Vortice.Direct3D11.ID3D11Resource.CalculateMipSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the resulting size at a single level for an original size.
member.param: The mip level to get the size.
Size of the base.
member.returns: Size of the mipLevel

member.name: M:Vortice.Direct3D11.ID3D11Resource.CalculateSubResourceIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates the sub resource index for a particular mipSlice and arraySlice.
member.param: The mip slice.
The array slice.
The size of slice. This values is resource dependent. Texture1D -> mipSize of the Width. Texture2D -> mipSize of the Height. Texture3D -> mipsize of the Depth
member.returns: The resulting miplevel calulated for this instance with this mipSlice and arraySlice.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The HLSL semantic associated with this element in a shader input-signature.

The semantic index for the element. A semantic index modifies a semantic, with an integer index number. A semantic index is only needed in a case where there is more than one element with the same semantic.
The value that specifies the format of the element data.
Offset, in bytes, between each element. Use (0xffffffff) for convenience to define the current element directly after the previous one, including any packing if necessary.
The input-assembler slot.
A value that identifies the input data class for a single input slot.

The number of instances to draw using the same per-instance data before advancing in the buffer by one element. This value must be 0 for an element that contains per-vertex data (the slot class is set to the member of ).

The y position of a tiled resource. Used for 2D and 3D textures.
The z position of a tiled resource. Used for 3D textures.

A subresource index value into mipmaps and arrays. Used for 1D, 2D, and 3D textures. For mipmaps that use nonstandard tiling, or are packed, or both use nonstandard tiling and are packed, any subresource value that indicates any of the packed mipmaps all refer to the same tile.
